ORO, MARIA T. PINILLOS Departamento de Quimica Inorgdnica, Unfuersiaad de Zaragoza, Saragossa (Spain) MIGUEL ROYO and EITEL PASTOR fnstituto de Catdlisis y Petroleoquzmica, Serrano 113, Madrid-6 (Spain) (Received July 20, 1981) The coordination chemistry of metallic derivatives of the pyrazolate ligand has been investigated [1] . In particular, several pyrazolate-bridged dinuclear rhodium complexes have been recently reported [2 - 61 . It is noteworthy to point out that the pyrazolate anion can displace the triphenylphosphine ligand from [Rh(COD)(PPh3)zj"" to produce [Rh(Pz)(COD)j2. No reaction was observed when this latter complex was treated with triphenylphosphine or triphenylphosphite [4 j . The new complex [Rh(Pz){P(OPh)3} 2j 2 was prepared by reaction of [Rh{P(OPh)3}2(Ilrfe2C0)sjCIO~ [7j or [Rh(COD){P(OPhf3}2]CIO,. [8j with pyrazoIe and sodium hydroxide. On the other hand, reaction of Rh2C12(COD){P(OPh)3}2 [9j with pyrazole and sodium hydroxide leads to the formation of Rh2(Pz)2(COD){P(OPh)3} 2. This mixed complex reacts with carbon monoxide to give the previously reported derivative [Rh(Pz)(CO)P(OPh)31 2 [4j . Other pyrazolate-bridged dinuclear rhodium complexes were prepared by conventional methods [4j . [Rh(Pz){P(OPh)3} 2j 2, [Rh(Pz)(CO)P(OPh)31 2 and the related [Rh(Me-Pz)(COD)j 2 (x = 2, 1, or 0) complexes dissolve in acetone to give catalyst solutions which hydroformylate 1-heptene. No hydrogenations were observed, but isomerization reactions are important (Fig. 1). Generally, selective conversion into aidehydes is nearly quantitative. Some results and reaction conditions are given in Table 1. The observed compositions (90) when the maximum percentage of trans-2-heptene was reached are presented in Table 2. The addition of triphenylphosphine to solutions of [Rh(MesPz)(COD)j 2 complexes causes a large decrease in isomerization activity and a consequent increase in selectivity. Related complexes of the type [Rh(Me,,Pz)(CO)PPh3j 2 are also hydroformylation catalysts; in particular, the complex [Rh(Pz)(CO)PPh3] 2 gives a catalytic solution very similar in its properties to that formed from [Rh(Pz)(COD)j 2 f 2 PPh3 (Fig. 1). We have checked that 376 so. i i co 1 30= a U20I i + i: I / X, i t5 30 c5 60 75 90 %mm Fig. 1. CO), the latter system gives [Rh(Pz)(CO)PPh312- With the exception of triphenylphosphite derivatives, some induction period (4 - 10 min) was observed for all the above-mentioned complexes. Higher induction periods (12 - 20 min) were found for the recently reported [5j thiocarbonyl analogues [Rh(M - Pz)(CS)PPhsj Z (s = 2 or 0) and [Rh(HMe2Pz)(CS)(DPh3)2) C104. References 1 F.
